definition: to choose somebody for a job or position of responsibility
to arrange or decide on a time or place for doing something
the state of being forced to do something because it is your duty, or because of a law, etc.
something which you must do because you have promised, because of a law, etc.
the process of making objects or activities of the same type have the same features or qualities; the process of making something standard
above your head; in the sky
(in ancient Greek stories) a creature with a man’s head, arms and upper body on a horse’s body and legs
(in stories) an animal like a white horse with a long straight horn on its head
a new company valued at more than a billion dollars, typically in the software or technology sector
having a strong desire to know about something
strange and unusual
asking too many questions and trying to find out about what other people are doing, etc.
very interested in learning about many different things
a person that you are playing or fighting against in a game, competition, argument, etc.
a person who is against something and tries to change or stop it
to understand or think of somebody/something in a particular way
to notice or become aware of something
to fail to have the effect that you had intended
to not work correctly because the petrol does not burn at the right time
to fail to send out a bullet, etc. when fired
done without any good reason or purpose and often having harmful effects
an environment where something is located; the place at which something happens
the place and time at which the action of a play, novel, etc. takes place
a position at which the controls on a machine can be set, to set the speed, height, temperature, etc.
the place on a computer or other electronic device where you can choose the way that it works or looks; the particular choices that you make
music written to go with a poem, etc.
a piece of metal in which a precious stone is fixed to form a piece of jewellery
a complete set of equipment for eating with (knife, fork, spoon, glass, etc.) for one person, arranged on a table
an area of land with a lot of houses or factories of the same type on it
a large area of land, usually in the country, that is owned by one person or family
all the money and property that a person owns, especially everything that is left when they die
a car with a lot of space behind the back seats and a door at the back for loading large items
a person whose job it is to carry something, especially at a ceremony
a person who brings a message, a letter, etc.
a person who has something with them or is the official owner of something, such as a document
a person who has knowledge of something, such as an idea or a tradition, and makes sure that it is not forgotten, by teaching others about it
a waiter
a male domestic servant or a worker who does another job that does not need special skills
lasting or intended to last or be used only for a short time; not permanent
the act or process of moving or the way something moves
a particular movement made usually with your hand or your head, especially to communicate something
a formal proposal that is discussed and voted on at a meeting
an act of emptying the bowels; the waste matter that is emptied from the bowels
to do or say something because you have to, not because you really want to
to start something moving
an act of moving the body or part of the body
an act of moving from one place to another or of moving something from one place to another
a group of people who share the same ideas or aims
a person’s activities over a period of time, especially as watched by somebody else
a slow steady change in what people in society do or think
progress, especially in a particular task
a change in amount
any of the main parts that a long piece of music is divided into
an act of emptying waste material from the bowels; the waste material that is emptied
connected with cooking or food
one of the very small structures like thin strings in the nuclei (= central parts) of animal and plant cells. Chromosomes carry the genes.
a flower with a sweet smell that grows on a bush with thorns (= sharp points) on its stems
a pink colour
a piece of metal or plastic with small holes in it that is attached to the end of a pipe or watering can so that the water comes out in a fine spray when you are watering plants
a round object that is fixed to the ceiling of a room for the wires of an electric light to go through
to be developing in a successful way
(not) an easy or a pleasant situation
to still have a good reputation, even though you have been involved in something that might have given people a bad opinion of you
to make somebody look healthy
what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
lasting only a short time
existing or most common at a particular time
the prevailing wind in an area is the one that blows over it most frequently
having no mistakes
the money that a court orders somebody to pay regularly to their former wife, husband or partner when the marriage or civil union is ended
a belief, custom or way of doing something that has existed for a long time among a particular group of people; a set of these beliefs or customs
a piece of business that is done between people, especially an act of buying or selling
the process of doing something
the amount of time it takes to unload a ship or plane at the end of one journey and load it again for the next one
the amount of time it takes to do a piece of work that you have been given and return it
a situation in which something changes from bad to good
a complete change in somebody’s opinion, behaviour, etc.
not definite or certain because you may want to change it later
not behaving or done with confidence
connected with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and experiment
that could possibly exist, happen or be true, although this is unlikely
a small round mark, especially one that is printed
a symbol like a full stop used to separate parts of a domain name, a URL or an email address
the shorter of the two signals that are used in Morse code
a small round mark that appears after a musical note to show that it should last for an extra half of its usual length, or above a musical note to show that it should be played staccato
exactly on time or at the exact time mentioned
a very long time ago
the medical study of the teeth and mouth
the work of a dentist
that is easily noticed by the mind or the senses
the act of examining part of the body by touching it
extremely unpleasant, especially in a way that offends people
a unit of work or energy
criminal; extremely bad
something that is done to cure an illness or injury, or to make somebody look and feel good
a way of behaving towards or dealing with a person or thing
a way of dealing with or discussing a subject, work of art, etc.
a process by which something is cleaned, or protected against something
a space between the bones of a baby’s skull, which makes a soft area on the top of the baby’s head
a move to a more important job or rank in a company or an organization
a move by a sports team from playing in one group of teams to playing in a better group
activities done in order to increase the sales of a product or service; a set of advertisements for a particular product or service
activity that encourages people to believe in the value or importance of something, or that helps something to succeed
a person who skis
to try or plan to achieve something
to have something as an aim
to say or do something that is intended to influence or affect a particular person or group
to point or direct a weapon, camera, shot, kick, etc. at somebody/something
all the circumstances and things that are happening at a particular time and in a particular place
the kind of location that a building or town has
a job
to prevent failure or defeat, when this seems certain to happen
an exam that you have passed or a course of study that you have successfully completed
a skill or type of experience that you need for a particular job or activity
information that you add to a statement to limit the effect that it has or the way it is applied
the fact of passing an exam, completing a course of training or reaching the standard necessary to do a job or take part in a competition
one of a pair of long narrow pieces of wood, metal or plastic that you attach to boots so that you can move smoothly over snow
either of the pair of long flat boards on which a person stands in order to waterski
